para.heading: Director.
para.text: "Director" means the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing or the Director's designee.

section.heading: License and compliance required.
section.text: No person may operate a peep show establishment unless the person:

para.text: obtains a license from the Director for the operation of the establishment, and
complies with the provisions of this subtitle.

section.heading: Investigation of applicant.
section.text: The Director must investigate each applicant for a new or renewal license to determine that:

para.text: the applicant did not knowingly make a material misstatement in the application; and
the establishment and its operation will comply with the requirements of:
the Building, Fire, and Related Codes of Baltimore City,
the Health Code of Baltimore City;
the Zoning Code of Baltimore City; and
all other applicable laws.

section.heading: Issuance of license.
section.text: The Director must issue or renew the license if, on investigation, the Director finds that all the requirements of this subtitle are met.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The Director may deny an application if, after the applicant has been given the opportunity for a hearing, the Director finds that any requirement of this subtitle is not met.

para.heading: Notice of reasons.
para.text: The Director must notify the applicant in writing of the reasons for the denial.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The Director may suspend or revoke any license issued under this subtitle if, after the licensee has been given the opportunity for a hearing, the Director finds that:
the licensee knowingly made a material misstatement on the application for the issuance or renewal of the license; or
the establishment or its operation is in violation of a requirement of:
the Building, Fire, and Related Codes of Baltimore City,
the Health Code of Baltimore City;
the Zoning Code of Baltimore City; or
all other applicable law.
The Director must notify the licensee in writing of the reasons for the suspension or revocation.
The notice must be mailed to the licensee at the address given on the most-recent application for a license.

para.heading: 12-month bar.
para.text: No person who has had a license revoked may obtain a new license at any time within 12 months from the date of the revocation.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Before the Director denies, suspends, or revokes any license or license renewal, the Director must notify the applicant or licensee in writing that a hearing will be held to determine whether grounds exist for the denial, suspension, or revocation.
has attached to it a permit tag issued by the Director.

section.heading: Enforcement.
section.text: In addition to any other remedy provided in this subtitle or otherwise by law, this subtitle may be enforced by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing in the manner provided in Baltimore City Code Article 1, Subtitle 42.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: No billiard, bagatelle, pool, manhattan, klondike, or rondo table may be erected, set up, kept, or in any respect whatever used for the purpose of gain or public entertainment within the City without a license previously obtained from the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

para.heading: Director.
para.text: "Director" means the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing or the Director's designee.
submits to the Director of Finance the full amount of that year's 1st quarterly installment plus the applicable service charge.

section.heading: License required.
section.text: It shall be the duty of the owner of a for profit theater, motion picture theater, hall used for entertainment, sports center, or museum, before permitting any person to use such facility for gain, to obtain a license from the Director of the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing for an annual fee of $165.

para.heading: Charitable exceptions.
para.text: But the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing is authorized to grant, free of expense, all applications for license for concerts or performances of any kind, where the proceeds are intended for charitable purposes.

para.heading: On application.
para.text: Before issuing any such license, the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall have such animated riding device inspected by the Commissioner of Housing and Community Development and shall obtain from him a certificate to the effect that the animated riding device has been inspected and is mechanically safe for operation.

para.heading: Semi-annually.
para.text: As a condition for retaining any such license, the applicant shall present to the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing at intervals of not more than 6 months thereafter, a similar certificate of inspection and safe condition.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall require each applicant for a license herein provided for to furnish proof of financial responsibility in the form of a written certificate from an insurance carrier authorized to transact business in the State of Maryland.

para.heading: Scope; amount.
para.text: Said certificate shall state that the applicant is insured against liability for damage including death or injury to persons and damage to property due to faulty equipment or negligence, and indemnifying the City against any suit or suits, losses, claims, damages, or expense to which the City may be subjected by reason of any damage to property or person, including death, or injury to the public highways and other public property done in or in connection with the transportation, erection, operation, maintenance, and supervision of such animated riding devices and said certificate shall be provided in an amount which in the discretion of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing will adequately protect the public.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Where the applicant is a nonresident, said applicant and said insurance carrier shall execute a power of attorney authorizing the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing to accept on their behalf service of notices, processes, and any action arising out of the ownership, operation, maintenance, or in any wise connected with said animated riding devices, while they are within the confines of the limits of the City of Baltimore.

para.heading: Corporations.
para.text: In the event that a nonresident corporation applies for a license, the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall issue said license provided:
the nonresident corporation complies with all conditions herein contained; and

in addition thereto, submits with its application for said license a certificate from the State Department of Assessments and Taxation certifying that the nonresident corporation is a duly constituted corporation authorized to do business in the State of Maryland.

para.heading: On application.
para.text: Before issuing any such license, the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall have such ride or riding device mounted on mobile equipment inspected by the Commissioner of Housing and Community Development and shall obtain from him a certificate to the effect that such ride or riding device mounted on mobile equipment has been inspected and is mechanically safe for operation.

para.heading: Semi-annually.
para.text: The applicant shall as a condition of retaining any such license present to the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing a similar certificate of inspection and safe condition at intervals of not more than 6 months thereafter.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall require each applicant for a license herein provided for to furnish proof of financial responsibility in the form of a written certificate from an insurance carrier authorized to transact business in the State of Maryland.

para.heading: Scope; amount.
para.text: Said certificate shall state that the applicant is insured against liability for damage including death or injury to persons and damage to property due to faulty equipment or negligence, and indemnifying the City against any suit or suits, losses, claims, damages, or expense to which the City may be subjected by reason of any damage to property or person, including death, or injury to the public highways and other public property done in or in connection with the transportation, erection, operation, maintenance, and supervision of such ride or riding device mounted on mobile equipment, and said certificate shall be provided in an amount which in the discretion of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing will adequately protect the public.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Where the applicant is a nonresident, said applicant and said insurance carrier shall execute a power of attorney authorizing the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing to accept service on their behalf of notices, processes, and any action arising out of the ownership, operation, maintenance, or in any wise connected with said ride or riding device mounted on mobile equipment while it is within the confines of the limits of the City of Baltimore.

para.heading: Corporations.
para.text: In the event that a nonresident corporation applies for a license, the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall issue said license provided:
the said nonresident corporation complies with all conditions herein contained; and

in addition thereto, submits with its application for said license a certificate from the State Department of Assessments and Taxation certifying that the nonresident corporation is a duly constituted corporation authorized to do business in the State of Maryland.

para.heading: Director.
para.text: "Director" means the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing or the Director's designee.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Except as specified in subsection (b) of this section, any person who proposes to locate 1 or more amusement devices in an establishment for the use of the general public must first obtain an amusement device location permit from the Director.

section.heading: Applications.
section.text: The application must be in the form and contain the information that the Director requires.

para.heading: Posting required.
para.text: Before a location permit (other than a renewal permit) may be issued, the applicant must post the proposed location for 15 days.

para.heading: 9 or fewer objections.
para.text: If, within the 15-day posting period, the Director receives no more than 9 written objections from persons within the same election precinct as the proposed location, the permit may be issued.

para.heading: 10 or more objections.
para.text: If, within the 15-day posting period, the Director receives 10 or more written objections from persons within the same election precinct as the proposed location, the Director must refer the matter to the Zoning Board for a hearing.
On referral by the Director, the Zoning Board must hold a public hearing on the proposed location permit.
Parties in interest and citizens must be given an opportunity to be heard at the hearing.
To renew a permit, the permit holder must apply no less than 30 days nor more than 60 days before the permit expires.
The renewal application must be in the form and contain the information that the Director requires.

On filing the renewal application and payment of the renewal fee, the Director must approve the application unless 10 or more written objections from persons within the same election precinct as the location in question are filed with the Director no later than 30 days before the permit expires.
If the Director receives 10 or more timely objections from persons within the same election precinct as the location in question, the Director must refer the matter to the Zoning Board for a hearing.

Subject to Title 4 {"Administrative Procedure Act – Regulations"} of the City General Provisions Article, the Director may adopt rules and regulations to carry out the administrative provisions of this subtitle.
These rules and regulations become effective 7 days after they are filed with the Department of Legislative Reference.

section.heading: Issuance of license.
section.text: The Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall issue all licenses for and numbers of carriages, wagons, and other vehicles, boats, and scows as enumerated in § 6-2.

para.heading: Owners to register annually.
para.text: The owner or owners of such carriages, boats, or scows, shall:
appear annually at the office of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing;
have entered in a book kept for that purpose:
the name and place of abode;
the description of every carriage, boat, or scow owned by the owner or owners; and
the number thereon to be affixed; and
take out a license containing his or her number, and signed by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing, with the City Seal affixed to it.

para.heading: Transfer of license.
para.text: Transfer of any of these licenses must be made at the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing Collector, and no charge will be made therefor.

It is the duty of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing, annually, on or before January 1 in each year, to purchase a sufficient number of tin plates, numbered with plain conspicuous figures, beginning with number 1, and so on progressively, 2 of each to correspond with the number of the carriage, boat, or scow, and also to purchase suitable dies for the arithmetical numbers.
The figures standing for the year in which those numbers were issued shall be stamped on the top of each numbered plate.
The plate shall be of suitable size and description in the discretion of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing, and paid for out of the appropriation for general licenses.

It is the duty of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing to furnish for each licensed carriage, boat, or scow, 2 of these tin plates, with number corresponding with the number of the license, and the record of that carriage, boat, or scow.
These numbered plates shall be fastened on each side of and the most conspicuous part of the carriage, boat, or scow, so that the numbers may be plainly seen.

para.heading: Private carriage license.
para.text: The Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall furnish to those who take out private carriage licenses, a single number, painted upon a tin plate that shall not measure more than 2¾ x 2 inches, which number shall be placed upon the hindermost part of the hind axle of the carriage by the owner or owners.

para.heading: Right to display own numbers.
para.text: All persons who take out licenses under this subtitle are hereby authorized to provide numbers for their carriages, wagons, and other vehicles, of such design as to them may seem proper, such numbers to conform with their license, the same to be in a conspicuous place; provided, that the number furnished by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing be nevertheless attached to such carriage or wagon in such place inside the carriage or wagon as he may direct.

para.heading: Notice.
para.text: All persons availing themselves of the privilege of this section can retain the same number from year to year by annual notice of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing previous to December 20 and those desiring to retain their old numbers may do so by similar notice.
appear at the office of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing and make entry and take out license as aforesaid;

section.heading: Withdrawal of license.
section.text: It shall be the duty of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing to withdraw the license from any vehicle licensed by the City, the driver of which shall violate a 2nd time any of the provisions of this Code regulating the speed of horses and vehicles.

section.heading: Subtitle to be advertised.
section.text: It shall be the duty of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing to notify all persons annually of the necessity of attending to the provisions of this subtitle, by advertising the same at least 10 days previous to January 1 in a daily paper of general circulation in Baltimore City, and of the privilege accorded by § 6-9 by advertising the same at least 5 days previous to December 20 in a daily paper of the City.

para.heading: Issuance, fees, records.
para.text: It shall be the duty of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing:
to issue licenses for employment agencies annually;
to charge for each and every such license the sum of $250 to be paid to the Director of Finance; and
to keep a record of the name and place of business of each and every person, firm, or corporation, who may take out such license, which record shall be kept on file in his office.

section.heading: Exhibition of license.
section.text: Every person, firm, or corporation, who shall take out a license under § 7-2, and who shall conduct an employment agency under such license:

para.text: shall register his, her, or its full name and address with the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing during the 1st week of January in each year; and
shall exhibit on the front of the building in which such business shall be conducted, a sign containing:
the words, "Licensed Employment Agency"; and
the name of the person, firm, or corporation so conducting such business.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: In this subtitle, the following terms have the meanings indicated.

para.heading: Business.
para.text: "Business" means any place of business or commercial activity conducted by a person, whether sales, service, rental, professional, or otherwise.

para.heading: Department.
para.text: "Department" means the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

para.heading: Director.
para.text: "Director" means the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

para.heading: Impact area.
para.text: "Impact area" means the area:
within the same election precinct as that in which a business is located; and
if a different precinct, within the election precinct of the block face opposing the block face in which a business is located.

para.heading: Late-night operations license; license.
para.text: "Late-night operations license" or "license" means a license issued under this subtitle.

section.heading: Rules, regulations, and forms.
section.text: Subject to Title 4 {"Administrative Procedure Act – Regulations"} of the City General Provisions Article, the Department must adopt rules, regulations, and forms to carry out this subtitle.

section.heading: Conditional license for late-night delivery services.
section.text: The Department may issue a late-night operations license for a business to operate a late-night delivery-only service, conditioned upon all indoor sales and dining areas being closed to the public during late-night hours.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Every application for an initial or renewal license must be in the form and contain the information that the Department requires.

para.heading: Posting and notice required.
para.text: On filing an application for an initial license, the applicant must, in accordance with the Department's rules and regulations:
post the premises for 15 days; and

within 5 days of the filing, send notice of the application by email or by certified or registered mail to the City Councilmember who represents the Councilmanic District in which the business is located.

If, within the 15-day posting period, the Department receives no more than 9 written objections from real property owners, commercial tenants that are not themselves holders of or applicants for a late-night operations license, or residents within the impact area of the business, the Department must grant or deny the license within 15 days after the last day of the 15-day posting period.
A denial must be based solely on one or more of the following factors:
any cause for denial that is specified in § 9-16 {"Denial, suspension, or revocation"} of this subtitle;
the specific days and hours proposed for late-night operations;
the lack or inadequacy of an indoor and outdoor security plan; and
the inability or unwillingness of the applicant to accept reasonable conditions on the license to protect the public health, safety, and welfare
The notice of a denial must:
state the reasons for the denial; and
notify the applicant of the applicant's right to appeal to the Director.
Within 30 days of receiving the notice of denial, the applicant may appeal to the Director for an administrative review of the application.

If, within the 15-day posting period, the Department receives 10 or more written objections from real property owners, commercial tenants that are not themselves holders of or applicants for a late-night operations license, or residents within the impact area of the business, the Department must:
deny the application; and
within 7 days after the last day of the 15-day posting period, notify the applicant of the denial and of the applicant's right to appeal to the Director.
Within 30 days of receiving the notice of denial, the applicant may appeal to the Director for an administrative review of the application.

para.heading: Director to decide.
para.text: Within 30 days after the timely filing of an appeal, the Director must notify the applicant in writing of his or her decision:
to affirm the denial of the license; or
to direct the Department to grant the license.

para.heading: Considerations.
para.text: In reviewing an application, the Director must consider:
all letters submitted in opposition to or support of the application;
any cause for denial that is specified in § 9-16 {"Denial, suspension, or revocation"} of this subtitle;
the specific days and hours proposed for late-night operations;
the adequacy of an indoor and outdoor security plan, including any evaluation made by the Police Commissioner or his or her designee; and
the ability and willingness of the applicant to accept reasonable conditions on the license to protect the public health, safety, and welfare.

para.heading: Term.
para.text: Each late-night operations license expires annually on the anniversary of its issuance and is renewable as provided in this section.

para.heading: Application for renewal.
para.text: To renew a license, the licensee must:
apply no less than 60 days nor more than 90 days before the license expires; and
in accordance with the Department's rules and regulations, post the premises for 15 days.

para.heading: Approval.
para.text: On filing the renewal application and payment of the renewal fee, the Department may approve the application, except as provided in subsection (d) of this section.

If, within the 15-day posting period, 10 or more written objections from real property owners, commercial tenants that are not themselves holders of or applicants for a late-night operations license, or residents within the impact area of the business, the Department must:
deny the application; and
within 7 days after the last day of the 15-day posting period, notify the applicant of the denial and of the applicant's right to appeal to the Director.
Within 30 days of receiving the notice of denial, the applicant may appeal to the Director for an administrative review of the application.
The filing of an appeal to the Director does not stay the decision of the Department pending the Director's decision.
The considerations and decision of the Director shall be as provided in § 9-9 of this subtitle.

para.heading: Board.
para.text: "Board" means the Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

section.heading: License required for massage establishments.
section.text: No person shall maintain, operate, or conduct a massage establishment within the City of Baltimore without a license previously issued by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

section.heading: Registration required for massagists.
section.text: No person maintaining, operating, or conducting a massage establishment shall employ, or otherwise allow, any individual to perform as a massagist, and no individual shall perform as a massagist, unless such individual shall have first been duly registered as a massagist for that particular massage establishment with the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

section.heading: Rules and regulations.
section.text: Subject to Title 4 {"Administrative Procedure Act – Regulations"} of the City General Provisions Article, the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing is authorized and empowered to promulgate and adopt rules and regulations to carry out the purpose and intent of this subtitle.

para.heading: Required information.
para.text: Applicants for a license under § 11-5 shall file upon a form provided by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing a signed application, subject to the law relating to perjury, setting forth the following information:
a definition of service to be provided;
the address where it is proposed to conduct the business for which application is made;
the name, local and permanent addresses, and local telephone number of each applicant;

if applicant is a corporation, the state of corporation, the names and residence addresses of each of the officers and directors of said corporation and of each stockholder owning more than 10% of the stock of the corporation, and the address of the corporation itself, if different from the address of the massage establishment;

if applicant is a partnership, the names and residence addresses of each of the partners including limited partners, and the address of the partnership itself, if different from the address of the massage establishment;
a photograph, at least 2 inches by 2 inches in size, showing the head and shoulders of the applicant in a clear and distinguishing manner;
description: height, weight, age, date of birth, color of hair and eyes, other distinguishing physical characteristics of the applicant;
a statement indicating whether the applicant has ever been licensed to practice or carry on the same business and, if so, when and where it was last practiced or carried on;

a statement that the applicant has never been convicted of any crime, motor vehicle laws excepted, or convicted of violation of any municipal code or ordinance or, if so convicted, the nature of the offense and the punishment or penalty imposed;

the number of rooms to be occupied by the business, together with a drawing of the interior arrangement and a list of the proposed equipment with a brief description of each piece of proposed equipment; and

the name and address of each massagist who is or will be employed in said establishment, together with a statement of his/her individual qualifications and the name and address of the last place of business where each individual worked.

para.heading: Application fee.
para.text: The sum of $25 shall accompany the application to reimburse the City for the cost of investigation, which sum shall be retained by the City whether the license is granted or denied.

para.heading: Successor license.
para.text: An application for a successor license shall be filed with the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing on or before April 1 of each year.

para.heading: Referral to Board.
para.text: The application shall be referred by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing to the Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing for investigation and recommendation.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: If the recommendation of the Board is favorable, the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall, upon payment of a license fee in the sum of $1,500 to the Director of Finance issue a license to the applicant.

para.heading: Term.
para.text: Every license so granted shall terminate on July 1 annually, or until a successor license is issued or denied by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

para.heading: Display.
para.text: The Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall issue a certificate of license which shall at all times be prominently displayed inside the massage establishment.

para.heading: Penalties.
para.text: Any person violating the provisions of this section shall, upon conviction, be punished as hereinafter provided in this subtitle and, in addition to such penalty, it shall be the duty of the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing to revoke the license of the establishment wherein the provisions of this section shall have been violated.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Any massage establishment, its equipment, records, and methods of operation shall be open during working or business hours to inspection by representatives of the Police Department, Health Department, Fire Department, Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing, and the Department of Housing and Community Development.

para.heading: Regular inspections to be made; reports.
para.text: The Police Commissioner, Health Commissioner, Chief of the Fire Department, Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing, and the Commissioner of Housing and Community Development shall assign personnel to make regular inspection of such licenses, and a report of such inspections shall be made to the respective department heads in writing.

para.heading: Denial of entry cause for revocation.
para.text: Denial of entry of such inspectors during business hours shall be cause for revocation of the license.

para.heading: Grounds.
para.text: Whenever the Director believes that any licensed massage establishment or registered massagist has violated any of the provisions of this subtitle, the rules and regulations promulgated by the Department, or is not qualified to hold a license, the Director may order a hearing before the Board.

para.heading: Notice and hearing.
para.text: Such hearing shall be held at a reasonable time and place designated by the Board in written notice to the licensee. The hearing shall not be held until at least 10 days following actual receipt of notice by the licensee.

para.heading: Decision.
para.text: Following such hearing, the Board shall reduce findings of fact to writing, and if it determines that the licensee has violated any of the provisions of this subtitle, the rules and regulations promulgated by the Department, or is unqualified under the provisions of this subtitle to hold the license in effect, it shall transmit a copy of such findings to the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing recommending revocation of the license, and the Director shall immediately revoke the license.

para.heading: License revocation.
para.text: Conviction for any violation of the provisions of this subtitle shall constitute cause for immediate revocation of the license by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing upon the recommendation of the Board.

No person may operate a commercial parking facility in the City of Baltimore unless the person has first obtained an annual license for the facility from the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing and has paid the annual fee for the license to the Director of Finance.
The term of a license is from May 1 of each year through April 30 of the next year.

The annual fee for a commercial parking facility license is $5.10 for every 100 square feet (or fraction of 100 square feet) of the gross area used for parking facility purposes, including all parking spaces, offices, ramps, driveways, aisles, toilets, car washing, greasing, or other facilities used in connection with the operation of the parking facility.
For a license issued after July 31 and before November 1, the fee is 75% of that prescribed for the entire year.
For a license issued after October 31 and before February 1, the fee is 50% of that prescribed for the entire year.
For a license issued after January 31, the fee is 25% of that prescribed for the entire year.
Any person desiring to operate a commercial parking facility for an aggregate of no more than 6 months in any 1 license year may obtain a special partial-year license.
The fee for a partial-year license is 1/12 of the annual license fee for each month or fraction of a month that the parking facility is in operation.

para.heading: Online licensee list.
para.text: The Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall maintain and post on the Department's website a current list of all commercial parking facilities licensed under this subtitle.

section.heading: Rules and regulations.
section.text: Subject to Title 4 {"Administrative Procedure Act – Regulations"} of the City General Provisions Article, the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing may adopt rules and regulations for the administration and enforcement of this subtitle.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: After a hearing conducted in accordance with the rules and regulations adopted under this subtitle and with proper notice to the license holder, the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing may revoke a license if the Department finds that the license holder violated any provision of this subtitle.

para.heading: Form and effect of revocation.
para.text: Any revocation under this subtitle must be in writing from the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing and specify the reasons for the action.

A license holder aggrieved by a decision of the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing may appeal that decision to the Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing in writing within 10 days of the Department's decision.
The Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing must issue a written decision within 30 days of receipt of the license holder's appeal.

para.heading: Director.
para.text: "Director" means the Director of the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing of the Director's designee.

section.heading: Issuance of license.
section.text: On receipt of a license application and upon the Director of Finance's receipt of the applicable license fee, the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall:

para.text: review the application; and
issue the license if the following conditions are met:
the security plan included in the application ensures that vehicles parked in the parking lot are protected from theft and vandalism at all times during hours of operations;

the traffic management plan included in the application ensures that the flow of pedestrian and vehicular traffic in the surrounding area is not significantly impeded by the operation of the parking lot; and
the application is otherwise complete, in accordance with the requirements of this subtitle.

para.heading: Department.
para.text: "Department" means the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

section.heading: Rules and regulations.
section.text: Subject to Title 4 {"Administrative Procedure Act – Regulations"} of the City General Provisions Article, the Department shall adopt rules and regulations to carry out this subtitle.

section.heading: License required.
section.text: No person may perform as a street entertainer without first having obtained a license to do so from the Department.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: In its rules and regulations, the Department shall:
designate various classes of licenses to be issued; and
for each class of license, specify:
the types of entertainment that may be performed under the license;
the locations or areas for which the license is effective;
the days and times for which the license is effective; and
the maximum number of licenses to be issued for a particular location or area or for a particular day or time of day.

para.heading: Required considerations.
para.text: In designating classes and specifying limitations, the Department shall consider:
the volume and types of vehicular and pedestrian traffic in a proposed street entertainment location or area;
the proximity of schools, religious institutions, parks, or residencies to a proposed street entertainment location or area;
the number of licenses issued to the same person; and
the impact of street entertainment activities on the health, safety, and general welfare of the public.

section.heading: Limitations and conditions.
section.text: The Department may impose reasonable limitations on any license issued under this subtitle, as necessary or proper to carry out the purpose and intent of this subtitle.

para.heading: Form.
para.text: An application for a license must be made in the form the Department requires.

para.heading: Application fee.
para.text: The application must be accompanied by a one-time, non-refundable application fee of $25, to cover the cost of investigating and processing the application.

para.heading: Contents.
para.text: The application must contain:
the applicant's name and address;
the applicant's age;
the type of entertainment for which the license is sought;
the location or area for which the license is sought; and
any other information the Department requires.

para.heading: Verification.
para.text: The application must be verified before a notary public or other officer authorized to administer oaths.

para.heading: Renewal.
para.text: Before a license expires, a licensee may renew it for an additional 1-year term, if the licensee submits to the Department a renewal application in the form the Department requires.

para.heading: Department to issue.
para.text: The Department shall issue an identification badge for each license issued.

para.heading: Form and contents.
para.text: The identification badge:
shall be of laminated plastic or other durable substance; and
shall bear:
the name and address of the licensee;
the type of entertainment for which the license is issued;
the location or area for which the license is issued;
the days or times to which the license is limited;
the year for which the license is issued; and
an identifying number that corresponds with the number of the license.

para.heading: Entertainer to display.
para.text: Each entertainer must prominently display the badge while entertaining.

para.heading: Replacement badges.
para.text: If a badge is lost, the Department shall issue a replacement badge on payment by the licensee of a $10 fee.

section.heading: BOPA to assist.
section.text: The Baltimore Office of Promotion and The Arts, or its successor, shall assist the Department by:

para.text: advertising and promoting the availability of licenses under this subtitle; and
distributing to licensees the licenses and badges issued under this subtitle.

para.heading: Authorized suspension or revocation.
para.text: The Department may suspend or revoke a license if the licensee violates any provision of:
this subtitle;
the rules and regulations adopted under this subtitle; or
any other applicable law of the State or City.

para.heading: Mandatory revocation.
para.text: On a street entertainer's 3rd violation of any provision, the Department must revoke the street entertainer's license.

para.heading: Application following revocation.
para.text: If a license is revoked, the former licensee may not apply for a new license until 1 year from the date of revocation.

para.heading: Right of appeal.
para.text: An aggrieved party may appeal to the Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing:
the denial, suspension, or revocation of a license; or
any other decision or ruling by the Department.

para.heading: How and when taken.
para.text: The appeal must be taken in writing within 10 days from the date of notice of the denial, suspension, revocation, decision, or ruling.

para.heading: Hearing and decision.
para.text: The Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing:
shall hold a hearing on the appeal as soon as practicable; and
may affirm, modify, or reverse the action of the Department.

para.heading: Department.
para.text: "Department" means the Baltimore City Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

para.heading: Department may adopt.
para.text: Subject to Title 4 {"Administrative Procedure Act – Regulations"} of the City General Provisions Article, the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing, in consultation with the Department of Transportation may adopt rules and regulations to carry out this subtitle.

para.heading: Public hearing and comment.
para.text: In accordance with General Provisions Article § 4-301, the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing must publish, for public hearing and comment, notice of all rules and regulations proposed for adoption under this subtitle.

para.heading: Effective date.
para.text: A copy of all rules and regulations under this subtitle must be filed with the Department of Legislative Reference at least 30 days before they take effect.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: After public notice has been provided to area business and neighborhood organizations, the Director of Transportation, in consultation with the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing may designate spaces on City streets or other public property as "mobile vending zones" for the exclusive use of mobile vendors during designated hours.

para.heading: Required considerations.
para.text: A proposed designation under paragraph (1) of this subsection must contain an assessment of the zone's potential impact on:
vehicular and pedestrian traffic, including any impediment to ingress to and egress from established businesses;
public safety and health;
parking in the area; and
area residents and businesses.

para.heading: Restriction on zones near schools.
para.text: No mobile vending zone may be designated within 2 blocks of the grounds of any building used as a public or private kindergarten, elementary school, or secondary school.

para.heading: Time-limited zones.
para.text: The mobile vending zones designated under this section may be set aside for the use of mobile vendors at all times or for specified times, dates, and days.

para.heading: Temporary relocation or suspension.
para.text: The Department of Transportation in consultation with the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing may temporarily relocate or suspend mobile vending zones at any time due to emergencies or to further public safety, public health interests, or City operations.

para.heading: Signage.
para.text: Mobile vending zones designated under this section must be marked by clear signs that specify the hours and times during which the zones are reserved for the exclusive use of mobile vendors.

para.heading: Rules and regulations.
para.text: The rules and regulations adopted under this subtitle must:
establish a process and timeline for requesting, establishing, assigning, and removing mobile vending zones; and
require a public hearing, as well as provide an opportunity for the filing of written protests, before a mobile vending zone is designated.

section.heading: License required.
section.text: No street vendor may operate in Baltimore City without first having obtained a license to do so from the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

para.heading: Required considerations.
para.text: In designating classes and specifying limitations, the Department, in consultation with the Department of Transportation, must consider:
the volume and types of vehicular and pedestrian traffic in a proposed vending location or area;
the proximity to a proposed vending location or area of schools, religious institutions, parks, and residences;
the number of licenses issued to the same person;
the impact of street vending activities on the health, safety, and general welfare of the public; and
comments from area schools, businesses, institutions, and residents.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing may impose reasonable limitations and conditions on any license issued under this subtitle, as necessary or proper to carry out the purpose and intent of this subtitle.

para.heading: Form.
para.text: An application for a license must be made in the form that the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing requires.

para.heading: Contents.
para.text: The application must contain:
the applicant's name and address;
the applicant's age;
the type of merchandise or service for which the license is sought;
the location or area for which the license is sought;
for the sale of any food product, evidence that the applicant has obtained the appropriate license from the Health Department; and
any other information that the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing requires.
The application must be signed and verified before a notary public or other officer authorized to administer oaths.

If the application is by a sole proprietorship, it must be signed by the owner; if by a partnership, it must be signed by an authorized partner; or, if by a corporation, limited liability company, or similar entity, it must be signed by an authorized officer.
in the form the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing requires; and

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing may issue a temporary license to be used in connection with a charitable, educational, artistic, civic, or other public function or activity.

para.heading: Department to issue.
para.text: The Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing must issue an identification badge for each license issued.

Instead of the badge provided for in § 17-24 {"Vendor identification – In general"} of this subtitle, the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing must provide the producer or grower with a sign to be displayed on his or her vehicle.
be in the form the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing requires; and

para.heading: Exception.
para.text: Subsection (a) of this section does not apply to a street vendor operating between the hours of midnight and 6 a.m. in accordance with the terms and conditions of a special event permit from the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing that explicitly grants permission to operate during those hours.

para.heading: Authorized suspension or revocation.
para.text: The Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing may suspend or revoke a license if the licensee violates any provision of:
this subtitle;
the rules and regulations adopted under this subtitle; or
any other applicable law of the State or City.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Provided further, that this subtitle shall not apply to a farmer or producer or person who offers for sale or sells to retailers, hotels, restaurants, processors, or public institutions or to commission merchants the products herein mentioned, or any of them, which were grown, raised, or produced, made, manufactured, caught, trapped, or killed, within the State of Maryland.

para.heading: Permit required.
para.text: But it shall be unlawful, however, for any such farmer or producer or person or any employees of such farmer or producer, or person to engage in the business of selling the products herein mentioned, or any of them, to retailers, hotels, restaurants, or public institutions within the City of Baltimore unless he applies annually to the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing for a permit so to sell.

Any farmer or producer or person desiring to secure such permit shall file with the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing annually an application, with his post office address, subscribed and sworn to before a notary public, which shall state that he will sell or offer for sale only such products as were grown, raised, produced, made, manufactured, caught, trapped, or killed in the State of Maryland.
It shall be the duty of the said Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing to investigate and verify the statements of the applicant if he is not satisfied with the proofs submitted.
The permits issued to farmers or producers or persons shall be in the form of a metal plate, on which shall be printed or stamped "Farmer's Permit No. ".
The fee for such permit shall not exceed $1 each.

para.heading: Display.
para.text: Said plate shall be displayed in a conspicuous place on wagon or other vehicle by said farmer or producer or person at all times when selling his products.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Written application therefor shall be made to the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing on forms prepared by the Director.
Such application shall contain:
the name and address of the applicant;
if the applicant is a firm, the name and address of each member of the firm; and
if the applicant is a corporation or association, the names and addresses of its principal officers.

The application shall contain such further information as may be required by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing in order to inform him fully as to the nature of the business, the equipment and facilities to be used.

section.heading: Revocation of license.
section.text: The Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing may revoke such license at any time by notice in writing whenever it shall appear to his satisfaction that the licensee has violated the provisions of this subtitle and has failed to correct same upon due notice from the Director.

section.heading: License required.
section.text: No person shall engage in business as a transient merchant unless he shall first have obtained a license to do so from the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

para.heading: Bond required.
para.text: Before such license is issued by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing, the applicant will be required to post a surety bond in an amount of $1,000, with a surety company licensed to do business in the State of Maryland.

section.heading: Reports by hotel keepers.
section.text: The owner, proprietor, or manager of any hotel, motel, rooming house, or other place of public accommodation shall report, within 6 hours after renting, to the Commissioner of Police and the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing, the name of any person who has rented a room or other space for the sale and display of merchandise of a transient merchant, giving the location of the room so rented.

para.heading: Department.
para.text: "Department" means the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

para.heading: Department shall adopt.
para.text: Subject to Title 4 {"Administrative Procedure Act – Regulations"} of the City General Provisions Article, the Department is required to promulgate and adopt rules and regulations to carry out the purpose and intent of this subtitle.

para.heading: Public hearing and comment.
para.text: In accordance with General Provisions Article § 4-301, the Department must publish, for public hearing and comment, notice of all rules and regulations proposed for adoption under this subtitle.

para.heading: Effect.
para.text: The rules and regulations shall have the same force and effect as law.
It shall be unlawful for any person to engage in a towing service in Baltimore City without a valid towing license issued by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.
Applications shall be made on forms furnished by the Department.
With the application, the applicant shall pay a non-refundable application fee of $100 to the Director of Finance.

Before the examination, the applicant shall pay an additional non-refundable fee, to be set from time to time by the Board of Estimates in an amount sufficient to cover the cost to the City of necessary background checks and investigations.
Prior to the issuance of a license, the Department shall determine the qualifications of each applicant to be licensed as hereinafter provided.
The Department shall conduct an investigation of the applicant for a towing service license.
The investigation shall include the following:
a determination that the applicant has the ability to engage in the licensed activity without detriment to the public;
the adequacy of the applicant's storage and/or repair facilities;
whether the storage facility is located in a location that is readily accessible for the recovery of a motor vehicle;

proof that the vehicle(s) to be licensed is properly registered and complies with all applicable laws, regulations, and rules established by the State of Maryland pursuant to the State Transportation Article;

proof that the applicant has complied with any other rule or regulation provided in this subtitle or, subject to Title 4 {"Administrative Procedure Act – Regulations"} of the City General Provisions Article, adopted by the Department; and
proof that the applicant's storage and/or repair facilities are located in a place which is properly zoned for such use.

No person shall be denied a license solely on the grounds that he has a criminal record, unless such conviction is within a period of 3 years prior to the application and involves the theft of property or constitutes a series of crimes which include the theft, receiving, or sale of stolen motor vehicles.
Each application shall include the name and business address of a natural person 18 years of age or older who:
is customarily present in an office in the City for the purposes of transacting business; and
has been designated by the applicant as the applicant's authorized agent:
for receiving notices issued pursuant to this subtitle; and
for receiving court process on behalf of the applicant in connection with the enforcement of this subtitle.
The Department must be notified within 10 days of any change in the designated agent.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: On approval by the Department of a license application and payment of the applicable license fee to the Director of Finance, the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall issue the license.

Every person engaged in providing towing services shall, at the time of application for a license, file with the Department a schedule setting forth the applicant's proposed charges for towing and for any services incident to towing.
The charges shall be stated clearly on the application for a towing services license filed by the person engaged in the towing business.

para.heading: Permitted basis.
para.text: The charges may be measured by mileage, time, and type of service or may be measured on a flat fee basis.

para.heading: Changes.
para.text: These charges shall not be changed without filing with the Department an amended schedule showing the charges proposed.

Every person who shall be licensed in the towing business under the provisions of this subtitle shall file with the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing a bond in the amount of $20,000 to save harmless the owner of any motor vehicle for any property damage occurring thereto during the time that it is in the possession of the person engaged in providing towing services.

shall make available in a reasonable time and manner, for inspection by the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing or the Police Department, its records kept in the ordinary course of business pursuant to this subtitle; and

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The motor vehicle shall be moved to the licensee's storage or repair facility customarily used by the person undertaking the towing or removal as designated in the license issued by Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing, unless directed otherwise by:
the Police Department;
the owner of the vehicle; or
the owner's authorized agent.

para.heading: Delay in delivery to storage facility.
para.text: It shall be unlawful for any towing service or tow truck operator to fail to immediately deliver any vehicle towed under this subtitle to its customarily used storage facility as provided for in the license issued by the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.

section.heading: Denial, revocation, suspension, refusal to renew.

para.text: In this section, "unfair or deceptive trade practice" means any false or misleading oral or written statement or representation of any kind that has the capacity, tendency, or effect of deceiving or misleading consumers, including any omission of material fact that would tend to mislead a consumer.
For purposes of this section, a plea of nolo contendere is the equivalent of a conviction or a guilty plea.

para.heading: Grounds for sanctions.
para.text: The Department is authorized to deny, suspend, revoke, or refuse to renew any license under this subtitle if:

the applicant or licensee furnished or made misleading or false statements on reports, certifications, or written documents that are required by this subtitle or that are otherwise submitted or caused by the applicant or licensee to be submitted to the Department;

during the preceding 3 years, a court of competent jurisdiction has found an applicant for a license or a licensee guilty of criminal activity directly relating to the operation of the business of towing;
a court of competent jurisdiction has found a tow truck operator guilty of a criminal act that was authorized by the licensee;

a motor vehicle has been towed by a towing service without the consent of the owner or operator of the motor vehicle, without the direction of the Police Department, or without complying with local, state, or federal law;
a tow truck operator has failed to comply with any law regulating the towing of motor vehicles;
the licensee has failed to make available for inspection by the Department or the Police Department the daily towing log required by § 22-10(d) of this subtitle;
the licensee has failed to allow the Police Department reasonable access to inspect any motor vehicle listed in the licensee's records that is stored upon the storage facility of the towing service;
within a 6-month period, the Department has received 5 or more individual complaints of unfair or deceptive trade practices against a given applicant or licensee; or

the applicant or licensee has failed to comply with or has violated the provisions of this subtitle, the rules or regulations adopted under this subtitle, or any applicable federal, state, or local law or rule.

The Department may deny, suspend, revoke, or refuse any license issued under this subtitle for a period of time determined by the Department to be just and reasonable in relation to the severity of the violation found to exist under subsection (b) of this section.

If a license has been denied, revoked, or not renewed, the applicant shall not be eligible to apply for another license for a period of 12 months after the date on which the Department rendered a denial, revocation, or refusal to renew decision.

para.heading: Hearing required.
para.text: No license shall be denied, suspended, revoked, or not renewed hereunder without the Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing first affording the licensee an opportunity for a hearing.
At least 15 calendar days prior to the date set for the hearing, the Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall:
notify the applicant or the licensee in writing of the date, time, and place set for the hearing;
specify the reason why the Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing proposes to refuse, deny, suspend, revoke, or not renew the application or license; and
afford all parties the opportunity to be heard in person and by counsel.
The written notice shall be served by registered or certified mail.

para.heading: Decision.
para.text: Within 10 working days following the hearing, the Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall render a decision and the reasons therefor in writing and shall forward a copy of the same to all parties by certified or registered mail.

para.heading: Judicial review.
para.text: A person aggrieved by a decision of the Board of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing under this subtitle may seek judicial review of the decision by petition to the Circuit Court for Baltimore City in accordance with the Maryland Rules of Procedure.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: The Department is hereby authorized to institute or cause to be instituted any and all legal or equitable actions or proceedings of any kind which may be necessary to enforce any and all provisions of this subtitle.

para.heading: Criminal proceedings not bar to other actions.
para.text: Nothing contained in this subtitle shall be construed to prevent the Department from instituting, causing to be instituted, or fully prosecuting any and all legal or equitable actions or proceedings of any kind necessary to compel compliance with any and all provisions of this subtitle, even though criminal proceedings may be pending or may have been completed.

para.heading: In general.
para.text: Any person or his agent violating any provision of this subtitle or any rule or regulation promulgated by the Department to effectuate the provisions of this subtitle, shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof, shall be subject to a fine of not less than $50 nor more than $500 or imprisonment for not more than 60 days, or both fine and imprisonment.

para.heading: Director of Finance.
para.text: Upon the approval of the Mayor, the Director of Finance shall have full power and authority to refuse to grant licenses under the provisions of the following subtitles of this article, and also, when directed by the Mayor, shall have full power and authority to revoke any license granted by virtue of the following subtitles of this article.
Subtitle 10. Hotels; and
Subtitle 48. Short-Term Residential Rentals.

para.heading: Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.
para.text: Upon the approval of the Mayor, the Director of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing shall have full power and authority to refuse to grant licenses under the provisions of the following subtitles of this article, and also, when directed by the Mayor, shall have full power and authority to revoke any license granted by virtue of the following subtitles of this article:
Subtitle 2. Amusements;
Subtitle 3. Amusement Device Location Permits;
Subtitle 6. Carriages, Wagons, Boats, and Scows;
Subtitle 7. Employment Agencies;
Subtitle 9. Late-Night Commercial Operations;
Subtitle 11. Massage Establishments;
Subtitle 12. Commercial Parking Facilities;
Subtitle 13. Special-Event Parking Lots;
Subtitle 15. Street Entertainers;
Subtitle 17. Street Vendors;
Subtitle 18. Itinerant Wholesale Produce Dealers;
Subtitle 20. Transient Merchants; and
Subtitle 22. Towing Services - Trespass Towing.
Director of the Department of Consumer Protection and Business Licensing.
